data.name: Infinite Precision Division
data.description:
When dividing numbers, sometimes the answer is simple. For example:
1/2=0.5
However, sometimes the answer has infinite digits after the decimal point, such as:
1/3=0.3 repeating
While this is perfectly understandable, sometimes the infinite digits take a while to start, so by surrounding the repeating digits in parentheses, the value is made more clear:
1/6=0.1(6)
Finally, division can also result in irrational numbers, in which case we may as well give 1000 digits after the decimal place, truncated because I'm lazy. I won't bother to put an example because it would scare you ;)

Also, since I am extremely cruel, you should be able to handle ANY type of Object I throw at you and assume that it has a String representation that is numeric. If it doesn't have that, then return null. I also threw in other weird test cases, so use those print statements!
